It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are smooth and lanceolate, with a waxy surface that helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
